ygData.subject: Re: [The EverQuest Tavern] Dark Elf restrictions
ygData.msgSnippet: City with the stone walls . . .   I assume you mean in Greater Fay? That would be Kelethin.  Yes, they ll skin you alive even more quickly than the Wood
ygData.messageBody:
"City with the stone walls . . . " I assume you mean in Greater Fay?
That would be Kelethin. Yes, they'll skin you alive even more
quickly than the Wood Elves. So will the Dwarves of Kaladim, if
that's the place you're thinking of (but the entrance to Kaladim is
in the next zone over, Butcherblock Mountains).

My advice is just to be a Dark Elf SK and kill everything in sight,
except your own people and maybe Ogre and Trolls. Relish your evil,
revel in it. You can always create an alt someday and go exploring
the good zones you've never gotten to see.


Kharlisht Kuzlidul, 28 Dwarf Rogue, semi-retired but thinking about
moving to Rallos Zek


--- In theeverquesttavern@y..., "the_dark_elf_drizzt_do_urden"
<joeyis007@y...> wrote:
> I've been killing orcs to build faction but so far it hasn't had an
> effect. How many do I have to kill before merchants will sell to
me?
> Also that city with the stone walls, do the guards attack me on
sight
> there? I'm afraid of trying to find out.
>
> So far I love the character there. )
